column4: no firefox 3.0 in ubuntu 7.10 repos? i got with apt-get install firefox-3.0 something called gran paradiso (firefox alpha8)
the backports will probably get upgraded eventually.  but no.
backports has beta...3? I think.
because 7.10 was released with firefox 2.  Firefox 3 will never be in the main repos, but might be backported
No need for that
no.
sudo apt-get clean
that'll clear it for you.
for what is it? and can i disable this?
and yes, you can automatically have to clean itself out, in apt.conf
its your cache for apt.  apt downloads files, then installs them from the local thing, and doesn't delete them (in case you reinstall later)
ok thanks
You can disable it (or at least, have it clear often) through apt.conf
ok i will do, thank you
you're welcome to do that, but please don't recommend it here.
You have to compile, then run it.  There's no way to do it all in a single command.  (Unless your single command is gcc -o test test.c && ./test)
First kdevelop compiles (if needed), then runs it
so kdevelop is using something like gcc -o test test.c && ./test
For our purposes, yes.
gpryatel_: sudo apt-get install openssh-server
ah sorry for the wrong name
